pair.Prompt: What was the case of Minneapolis & St. Louis R. Co. v. U.S. about?
pair.Response: Response: Minneapolis & St. Louis R. Co. v. U.S. was a case about the approval of a contract to sell 50% of the outstanding capital stock of Western to the Pennsylvania Company, a wholly owned subsidiary of Pennsylvania. The Minneapolis intervened and objected to the application, as did also the States of Minnesota and South Dakota and their respective public service regulatory commissions. The case was decided on October 13, 1955 by the U.S. Supreme Court, with the opinion of the court being delivered on October 13, 1959.
